Other Information.Additional Info: Enrichment factor (EF) reaches 5.1 at 30 K and 1.0 bar
Competitive adsorption exists between D2 and H2; adsorption affinity toward D2 becomes stronger at lower temperatures

Sieving Mechanism: Chemical affinity quantum sieving effect dominates the separation process

Experimental Validation.Method: Breakthrough experiment, GCMC simulation, ACTDS measurements
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: IAST-predicted D2/H2 selectivity: 1.4 at 77 K, Enrichment factors (EF): 3.3 at 50 K, 4.4 at 40 K, 5.1 at 30 K

Other Information.Additional Info: High hydrophobic property stabilizes long-term separation performance
